item.title: xDB: Sitecore DMS Moves to MongoDB
item.description:
xDB: Sitecore DMS Moves to MongoDB

When Sitecore feels that they have moved the ball significantly, they tend to mark the occasion with a name change or two. So when batched writes came to the Online Marketing System (OMS), it became the Digital Marketing Suite (DMS), and when personalization was fully integrated into the Page Editor, it became, officially at least, the Experience Editor, and the CMS + DMS combination became the Customer Experience Platform.

item.title: Customers Don't Buy Products, They Buy Outcomes
item.description:
Customers Don't Buy Products, They Buy Outcomes

By Darren Guarnaccia, November 20, 2015 | | Customer experience is a series of interactions that bring someone to the outcome they want. Product doesn't always take center stage. I've said it in front of audiences worldwide, and heads start nodding immediately in agreement: "Customers don't buy products, they buy outcomes."

item.title: Align Your Company Around Digital Experience
item.description:
Align Your Company Around Digital Experience

By Mark Floisand, November 18, 2015 | | This article was originally published on CMSWire. Every day, the need for a cohesive digital strategy gets more and more vital. And every day, mapping out the digital experience gets more complex.

item.title: Silverman's Best and Brightest presented by CarMax: Patriots-Dolphins 10/29
item.description:
Silverman's Best and Brightest presented by CarMax: Patriots-Dolphins 10/29

Team photographer, David Silverman, offers his best photos from the Patriots game against the Miami Dolphins at Gillette Stadium on Thursday, October 29, 2015.

item.title: Hide Items without Versions from the Content Tree in the Sitecore ASP.NET CMS | John West | Sitecore Blog
item.description:
Hide Items without Versions from the Content Tree in the Sitecore ASP.NET CMS | John West | Sitecore Blog

This blog post explains an approach that you can use to hide items without versions in the current content language from the content tree in the Sitecore ASP.NET web Content Management System (CMS) and Experience Platform (XP).

item.title: The problem with 'pumpkin spice' security bugs
item.description:
The problem with 'pumpkin spice' security bugs

Bad Password is a hacking and security column by Violet Blue. Every week she'll be exploring the trendy new cyberhysteria, the state of the infosec community and the ever-eroding thing that used to be called "privacy." Bad Password cuts through the greed, fear mongering and jargon with expertise, a friendly voice and a little level-headed perspective.

item.title: Welcome to the era of Context Marketing
item.description:
Welcome to the era of Context Marketing

By Michael Seifert, October 18, 2015 | | I enjoy the experience of buying a new product much more than actually receiving it. The timespan between desire and fulfillment reminds me of when I was a kid and could not wait to open my Christmas presents.

item.title: Sitecore Multisite, Part 2: Authentication | John West | Sitecore Blog
item.description:
Sitecore Multisite, Part 2: Authentication | John West | Sitecore Blog

This blog post contains information about using different technologies and authenticating different populations of users against separate sites managed by the Sitecore ASP.NET web Content Management System (CMS) and Customer Engagement Platform (CEP). This multisite challenge is not specific to Sitecore, but Sitecore provides some solutions.

item.title: Nexus 6P Review: Google And Huawei Have Made Magic
item.description:
Nexus 6P Review: Google And Huawei Have Made Magic

A week ago, we took an early look at the Nexus 6P, the larger and more "premium" of Google's phones for 2015. Now that I've lived with the 6P for a bit longer, it's time for the full review. As stated in the preview post, the 6P is undoubtedly the more premium of the two new Nexuses.
